results.title: Between the wars: the Spanish Civil War
results.creator_credit: Anthony Potter, Scott Garen, Alan Landsburg Productions and Films Incorporated
results.brief_description: A balanced account showing how the inadequate response of the great democratic powers - France, Britain and the United States - power politics of Germany and Italy heightened Axis contempt for them and encouraged Axis expansion. Suitable for middle and upper secondary levels.

results.title: Between the wars. - 4.
results.creator_credit: William T. Cartwright, REG and Anthony Potter Productions
results.brief_description: The first of this two-part analysis of Roosevelt and Hitler, “Their rise to power” contrasts the careers and styles of the two men to show how individual leadership can influence history. The careers of both men culminated in 1933 when Hitler achieved total control of Germany through propaganda and terrorism and Roosevelt introduced The New Deal. “The Dynamics of power” contrasts their use of the media to further their aims, Roosevelt through his radio fireside chats, and Hitler, ie. Goebbels, through the brilliant use of Leni Riefenstahl’s films and newsreels, culminating in the Berlin Olympics.
results.creator_credit_for_label: William T. Cartwright, REG and Anthony Potter Productions

results.title: Between the wars. - 3.
results.creator_credit: Charles Musser, Michael D. Ornstein, Anthony Potter, REG and Anthony Potter Productions
results.brief_description: Radio, racism and foreign policy examines America’s attempt at isolationism after the horrors of the first world war. Strict immigrant quotas are imposed, ushering in an ugly period of racism and ethnic discrimination. The advent of radio helps to project the image of the ‘good American’, but also lets in news of foreign relations. “The great depression and foreign affairs” describes how the Depression shatters America’s confidence in the American Dream leading to further isolationism which results in America ignoring the rise of totalitarianism elsewhere and Japan’s invasion of China.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Charles Musser, Michael D. Ornstein, Anthony Potter, REG and Anthony Potter Productions

results.title: Between the wars. - 2.
results.creator_credit: Scott Garen, Anthony Potter, REG and Anthony Potter Productions
results.brief_description: The first SALT talks unfolds the story of the beginning of the arms race between the United States, Great Britain and Japan after the first world war, diplomatic attempts to curb it and the development of the aeroplane as a military weapon. “America in the Pacific”, subtitled “a clash of two cultures” details the increasing suspicion and mistrust between America and Japan and Japan’s rapid rise as an imperialistic military power, culminating in the Russo-Japanese war and the Sino-Japanese conflict. Uses archival footage and interviews with historians. Narrated by Eric Sevareid.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Scott Garen, Anthony Potter, REG and Anthony Potter Productions

results.title: Between the wars. - 1.
results.creator_credit: Anthony Potter, Reeves Entertainment Group and Anthony Potter Productions
results.brief_description: In these first two programs we follow President Woodrow Wilson’s struggles to involve the United States in the League of Nations. His passionate idealism made him unable to compromise, leading to the harsh conditions imposed upon Germany in the Treaty of Versailles, and his defeat in the United States Senate by those who did not wish to involve America in foreign affairs. Narrated by Eric Sevareid.

results.title: Between the tides
results.creator_credit: Ralph Keene, Ian Ferguson and British Transport Films
results.brief_description: Reveals some of the animal and plant life not always visible to the naked eye, and shows the fascinating creatures which can be found in rock pools and shallow waters among the breeding grounds of Britain’s sea-birds. The film brings to light a wealth of pictorial information in the best traditions of the nature documentary film and was awarded prizes at a number of international film festivals between 1958 and 1960.

results.title: Between rational numbers
results.brief_description: taches the concept of an infinite set of numbers, using the story of a tricky old king who promises his kingdom to any of the knights who can tell him the next rational number after one third.

results.title: Between glass and concrete
results.brief_description: This film gives an impression of a number of new theatres and concert halls, and the new ideas on architecture and theatrical production which they embody. Indicates the popularity of theatre-going in Germany and the international scope of the programmes. No other credits available.

results.title: Between generations
results.creator_credit: Rebecca Phillips, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.brief_description: Rebecca Phillips considers how much has changed since her mother went to school. Perhaps she could now sit at the tables and play with the other kids, but she still felt ostracised for being different. Despite this, she has learnt to be proud of her heritage and found her place in the world.
